extends java.rmi.Remote

    • Method Detail

      • signInPlayer

        Player signInPlayer(java.lang.String user,
                    java.lang.String pwd,
                    ClientInterface client)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                    UserAlreadyLoggedException
        Permit the player login
        Parameters:
        user - the username for the login
        pwd - the password for the login
        client - the Client who make the access
        Returns:
        Player instance if the login succeed,null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - the remote excpetion
        UserAlreadyLoggedException, - if the Player is already logged from another host
        UserAlreadyLoggedException

      • signUpNewPlayer

        void signUpNewPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String surname,
                     java.sql.Date date,
                     java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String email)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sing up a new Player into the db
        Parameters:
        name - the player's name
        surname - the player's surname
        date - the player's date of birth
        username - the player's authentication username
        pwd - the Player's authentication password
        email - the Player's email
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - the remote exception

      • isFieldAvailabe

        boolean isFieldAvailabe(java.lang.String field,
                        java.lang.String value)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        check if the field marked is available for the specified value in the database
        Parameters:
        field - the field you want to check availability
        value - the value assigned at the field
        Returns:
        true, if the value is available for the specified field
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - the remote exception
